summary: Mewtwo was awesome in detective pikachu don’t you think?
question: Mewtwo was awesome in detective pikachu don’t you think?
answer:
He was pretty cool, but that’s basically a necessity for Mewtwo.

My favorite was Bulbasaur though. I loved those adorable little onion bois.

summary: TE SENTIRÁS INVESTIGADOR CON ESTE MUÑECO TAMAÑO REAL DE DETECTIVE PIKACHU #shirotenshi #CorporativoArcanos #Noticias #Peluche...
title: TE SENTIRÁS INVESTIGADOR CON ESTE MUÑECO TAMAÑO REAL DE DETECTIVE PIKACHU #shirotenshi #CorporativoArcanos #Noticias #Peluche #Juguetes #DETECTIVEPIKACHU
body:
Después de ver Detective Pikachu, muchos fans por fin saciaron su curiosidad por saber cómo es que se verían varios pokémon en la vida real, entre ellas el famoso ratón eléctrico. Sin embargo, tras verla ahora muchos se han quedado con la duda de saber qué se sentiría contar con un Pikachu de verdad a nuestro lado o, inclusive, sobre los hombros. Bueno, pues ahora y gracias a la compañía Megahouse

View On WordPress

summary: I made Detective Pikachu’s deerstalker hat in cake form for #PokeNoms!  I wanted to make the hat entirely out of cake and icing,...
caption:
I made Detective Pikachu’s deerstalker hat in cake form for #PokeNoms!

I wanted to make the hat entirely out of cake and icing, without relying on fondant or skewers! I use a dome cake mold to get the shape, and sliced about an inch off the bottom to form the brim of the hat. I coated the whole thing liberally in icing, and used a mesh strainer to get the texture. It was challenging, but a fun little project!

Official Detective Pikachu hat for scale!

blog.name: wiseabsol
blog.title: WiseAbsol
blog.description: Aka Abigail Brooks. Writer, editor, and occasional baker. Your stereotypical English major.

summary:
panicbox reblogged  your link: Detective Pikachu Writer Reveals Why Film Connects...
                    Nope. Doesn’t line up...
body:
panicbox

reblogged

your link:

Detective Pikachu Writer Reveals Why Film Connects…

Nope. Doesn’t line up age wise (Harry has a son in his 20’s. The man is not in his 30’s) and there are a few problems…

I mean. We are talking a split-second assumption before Mewtwo would realize, “Oh shit, wait, that’s not him.” So I think the theory works just fine (especially because, as an around 20-year-old himself, Mewtwo would probably have trouble distinguishing between a 30- and 40-year-old human man. And let’s be real–Ash lives a hard life. Kid would go prematurely gray anyway). 

As for him repeating the sentiment of the father-son duo teaching him that not all humans are bad–yes, that is odd, but given that he just got recaptured, experimented on, and had someone hijack his body, I could see him being like, “Well maybe Ash was an exception to the rule.” 

Plus, the Mewtwo in the videogames–with the exception of the game this movie was based on–can’t talk, as far as I know. You could headcanon that he learned how to speak over twenty years, but I feel like that’s stretching things farther than Mewtwo just having a lapse in faith in humanity when he was, again, captured and abused by them.
